example:
A: Is there anything else you need help with? 
B: Nope, that’s everything. Off you go! 
A: Are you sure? I can stay a bit longer. 
B: Seriously, you're free to go, enjoy your night. 
A: Alright, I'm heading out then. 
B: Run along, I'll see you tomorrow morning!
japanese: 行（い）っていいよ。／さあ行（い）け。
chinese: 我正顺风顺水呢 (Wǒ zhèng shùnfēngshùnshuǐ ne) / 手感热得发烫 (Shǒugǎn rè de fātàng)

primary: Why couldn't I bring myself to say it?
similar: I couldn't get the words out.
example:
A: Did you tell him you love him?
B: No. Why couldn't I bring myself to say it?
A: Fear of rejection?
B: Probably.
A: Try again tomorrow.
B: If I'm brave.
japanese: なんで言（い）えなかったんだろう。／言（い）えばよかった。
chinese: 别放在心上 (Bié fàng zài xīnlàng) / 没啥大不了的 (Méishá dàbùliǎo de)

example:
A: Is it free?
B: Yes, eat your fill.
A: I will regret this later.
B: That's future you's problem.
A: Present me is happy.
B: Bon appetit.
japanese: 腹（はら）いっぱい食（た）べな。／食（く）い倒（だお）れろ。
chinese: 太划算了 (Tài huásuàn le) / 简直是白菜价 (Jiǎnjié shì báicàijià)

example:
A: Will he survive?
B: It was touch and go for a while.
A: But now?
B: He's stable.
A: Thank god.
B: Miracle.
japanese: 際（きわ）どい状況（じょうきょう）。／一進一退（いっしんいったい）。
chinese: 理智点儿 (Lǐzhì diǎnr) / 打起精神来 (Dǎ qǐ jīngshén lái)

example:
A: You look pale.
B: I felt so troubled about the news.
A: Don't let it eat you up.
B: Hard not to.
A: Breathe.
B: Trying.
japanese: 心（こころ）が痛（いた）んだ。／気（き）が重（おも）かった。
chinese: 有进展随时跟我说 (Yǒu jìnzhǎn suíshí gēn wǒ shuō) / 保持沟通 (Bǎochí gōutōng)

example:
A: The quantum fluctuation implies...
B: Say what? I'm lost.
A: It's simple physics.
B: To you maybe.
A: I'll draw a picture.
B: Please.
japanese: え、何（なに）だって？／話（はなし）についていけない。
chinese: 显而易见 (Xiǎn'éryìjiàn) / 这还用问吗 (Zhè hái yòng wèn ma)

example:
A: Are you rich?
B: I wish.
A: You have a Gucci bag.
B: It's fake.
A: Looks real.
B: That's the point.
japanese: そうならいいのに。／だったらなぁ。
chinese: 我累瘫了 (Wǒ lèi tān le) / 精疲力尽 (Jīngpílìjìn)

example:
A: Can we get a dog?
B: Not happening.
A: A small one?
B: No poop machines.
A: I'll clean it.
B: Lies.
japanese: 絶対（ぜったい）ない。／あり得（え）ない。
chinese: 别得寸进尺 (Bié décùnjìnchǐ) / 差不多得了 (Chàbùduō déle)

meaning: 술 마시기 전에 먼저 한잔하는 것. (1차 전)
example:
A: Coming to the club?
B: We're pregaming at Mike's place first.
A: Save me a shot.
B: Hurry up.
A: On my way.
B: Don't be late.
japanese: 景気（けいき）付（づ）けに飲（の）む。／（パーティー前（まえ）の）宅飲（たくの）み。
chinese: 到时候再说吧 (Dào shíhòu zàishuō ba) / 走一步看一步 (Zǒu yībù kàn yībù)

example:
A: Do you know this city well?
B: I was born and raised here.
A: Best pizza place?
B: Tony's.
A: Take me.
B: Let's go.
japanese: 生粋（きっすい）の。／地元（じもと）民（みん）。
chinese: 直奔主题 (Zhíbèn zhǔtí) / 别绕弯子 (Bié ràowānzi)

similar: Just what I wanted to hear.
example:
A: The boss said we get a bonus.
B: That is music to my ears.
A: And a day off.
B: Even better.
A: But not until next month.
B: I can wait.
japanese: 嬉（うれ）しい知（し）らせだ。／心地（ここち）よい響（ひび）きだ。
chinese: 处境相同 (Chǔjìng xiāngtóng) / 是一条绳上的蚂蚱 (Shì yītiáo shéng shàng de màzha)

primary: Cut to the chase / get to the point
example:
A: So, regarding the project, there are many factors... 
B: Look, just cut to the chase. 
A: Well, we might need a bigger budget. 
B: Get to the point, how much more do you need? 
A: About five thousand dollars. 
B: Finally, give it to me straight next time!
japanese: 単刀直入（たんとうちょくにゅう）に言（い）って。／要点（ようてん）だけ言（い）って。
chinese: 都是你瞎想的 (Dōu shì nǐ xiāxiǎng de) / 心理作用 (Xīnlǐ zuòyòng)

example:
A: Where are you?
B: I'm running 20 minutes late.
A: Movie starts in 10.
B: Buy popcorn.
A: I'll eat it all.
B: Save some.
japanese: 20分（ぷん）くらい遅（おく）れる。／遅刻（ちこく）確定（かくてい）。
chinese: 别灰心 (Bié huīxīn) / 挺起胸膛 (Tǐng qǐ xiōngtáng)

example:
A: Did you sneak out?
B: Yeah, but I got busted.
A: By who?
B: Mom was waiting in the kitchen.
A: Scary.
B: Terrifying.
japanese: バレた。／見（み）つかった。
chinese: 稀罕事儿 (Xīhanshìr) / 难德一见 (Nándé yī jiàn)

meaning: 그날 있었던 일 좀 자세히 말해봐.
example:
A: I lost the contract.
B: Walk me through that day.
A: I overslept...
B: Bad start.
A: Then I spilled coffee.
B: Classic.
japanese: その日（ひ）のこと詳（くわ）しく話（はなし）て。／再現（さいげん）して。
chinese: 小菜一碟 (Xiǎocài yī dié) / 易如反掌 (Yìrúfǎnzhǎng)

example:
A: I'll clean your room for free.
B: What's the angle?
A: No angle.
B: You want to borrow my car.
A: Maybe.
B: I knew it.
japanese: 狙（ねら）いは何（なに）？／魂胆（こんたん）は？
chinese: 振作起来 (Zhènzuò qǐlái) / 冷静冷静 (Lěngjìng lěngjìng)

example:
A: Why is he crying?
B: I snapped at him.
A: Why?
B: He chewed with his mouth open.
A: Reasonable.
B: I feel bad though.
japanese: キレた。／プッツンした。
chinese: 替 wǒ 想想 (Tì wǒ xiǎngxiǎng) / 换位思考 (Huànwèi sīkǎo)

example:
A: Who ate the cake?
B: The dog was my accomplice.
A: Looking at his face, he's guilty.
B: We split it 50/50.
A: You're both grounded.
B: Worth it.
japanese: 共犯（きょうはん）者（しゃ）。／グル。
chinese: 看法一致 (Kànfǎ yīzhì) / 志同道合 (Zhìtóngdào合)

example:
A: Where are you going?
B: To visit someone in the hospital.
A: Nothing serious?
B: Just a broken leg.
A: Sign the cast for me.
B: Will do.
japanese: お見舞（みま）いに行（い）く。／顔（かお）を見（み）に行（い）く。
chinese: 保重 (Bǎozhòng) / 注意安全 (Zhùyì ānquán)

primary: I don't have it on me
example:
A: Can I borrow $10?
B: I don't have it on me.
A: You have a wallet.
B: Digital wallet only.
A: Transfer me.
B: No signal.
japanese: 持（も）ち合（あ）わせがない。／手持（ても）ちがない。
chinese: 觉得理所当然 (Juéde lǐsuǒdāngrán) / 不珍惜 (Bù zhēnxī)

meaning: 줄은 저 뒤가 끝이에요. (새치기 하지 마)
example:
A: Excuse me.
B: The line starts back there.
A: I just have one question.
B: So do they.
A: Tough crowd.
B: Fair crowd.
japanese: 最後尾（さいこうび）はあっちだよ。／並（なら）んで。
chinese: 两全其美 (Liǎngquánqíměi) / 鱼和熊掌兼得 (Yú hé xióngzhǎng jiāndé)

example:
A: Did you talk to him?
B: No, I decided to sever ties.
A: Drastic.
B: Necessary.
A: Peace of mind?
B: Exactly.
japanese: 断（た）つ。／縁（えん）を切（き）る。
chinese: 总而言之 (Zǒng'éryánzhī) / 长话短说 (Chánghuà duǎnshuō)

meaning: 통 크게 하거나 아니면 관두거나 / 최선을 다해
example:
A: Should we just throw a small party for the launch? 
B: No way, go big or go home. 
A: But a huge event will be so expensive. 
B: It's all or nothing if we want to make an impact. 
A: I guess we should go for broke then. 
B: Exactly, let's give it our all!
japanese: 派手（はで）にやろう。／中途半端（ちゅうとはんぱ）はなしだ。
chinese: 身体微恙 (Shēntǐ wēiyàng) / 没精神 (Méi jīngshén)

example:
A: You quit your job?
B: I was rash.
A: Can you go back?
B: I burned the bridge.
A: Well then.
B: Startup life begins.
japanese: 早（はや）まったことした。／浅（あさ）はかだった。
chinese: 口碑 (Kǒubēi) / 亲口相传 (Qīnkǒu xiāngchuán)

example:
A: Are you okay?
B: Just tired.
A: You seem gaunt.
B: I haven't slept in days.
A: Eat a burger.
B: I need sleep, not food.
japanese: やつれてるよ。／ゲッソリしてる。
chinese: 当然 (Dāngrán) / 没错 (Méicuò)

example:
A: Did he talk to the cops?
B: Sang like a canary.
A: We're doomed.
B: Pack your bags.
A: Mexico?
B: Mars.
japanese: 洗（あら）いざらい話（はな）す。／ペラペラしゃべる。
chinese: 闭嘴 (Bìzuǐ) / 别说了 (Bié shuō le)

primary: Eat someone out of house and home
meaning: 집안 기둥뿌리 뽑히게 먹다. (엄청 많이 먹다)
example:
A: Your teenagers are here.
B: They're going to eat me out of house and home.
A: Order pizza.
B: Ten pizzas.
A: Good luck.
B: Send help.
japanese: 食（く）いつぶす。／エンゲル係数（けいすう）爆上（ばくあ）がり。
chinese: 回到原点 (Huí dào yuándiǎn) / 全部重来 (Quánbù chónglái)

example:
A: He seems moody.
B: Your success is eating him up inside.
A: He should be happy for me.
B: Ego is a fragile thing.
A: That's sad.
B: It is.
japanese: 嫉妬（しっと）に狂（くる）ってる。／彼（かれ）を蝕（むしば）んでる。
chinese: 稳妥起见 (Wěntuǒ qǐjiàn) / 有备无患 (Yǒubèiwúhuàn)

example:
A: It started raining as soon as I washed the car.
B: It figures.
A: Every time.
B: The universe hates clean cars.
A: Apparently.
B: Wash it again.
japanese: やっぱりね。／案（あん）の定（じょう）。
chinese: 回头见 (Huítóu jiàn) / 待会儿见 (Dài huìr jiàn)

example:
A: Why is he crying?
B: The boss cursed him out.
A: For what?
B: Spilling coffee.
A: Harsh.
B: Very.
japanese: 罵倒（ばとう）する。／こき下（お）ろす。
chinese: 人不可貌相 (Rén bùkě mào xiàng) / 别看表象 (Bié kàn biǎoxiàng)

example:
A: Will you finish on time?
B: I'll get it done, one way or the other.
A: That sounds ominous.
B: Determination.
A: Good luck.
B: Thanks.
japanese: なんとかして。／どのみち。
chinese: 饶了我吧 (Ráo le wǒ ba) / 快拉倒吧 (Kuài lādǎo ba)

example:
A: How was your trip?
B: It had its twists and turns.
A: Sounds like an adventure.
B: Or a nightmare.
A: Tell me more.
B: Buy me a drink first.
japanese: 波乱（はらん）万丈（ばんじょう）。／山（やま）あり谷（たに）あり。
chinese: 大胆去做吧 (Dàdǎn qù zuò ba) / 上吧 (Shàng ba)

example:
A: Find my lost cat.
B: Any reward?
A: I will reward you handsomely.
B: Cash?
A: And cookies.
B: I'm on it.
japanese: たんまり礼（れい）をする。／弾（はず）むよ。
chinese: 手拿开 (Shǒu ná kāi) / 别碰 (Bié pèng)

meaning: (어렵거나 하기 싫은 일을) 감수하다 / 매도 먼저 맞는 게 낫다
example:
A: I really don't want to tell the boss I lost the file. 
B: You just have to bite the bullet and tell him. 
A: He’s going to be so angry. 
B: Just face the music now so it's over with. 
A: You're right, I'll go to his office now. 
B: Good, suck it up and get it over with.
japanese: 覚悟（かくご）を決（き）める。／腹（はら）をくくる。
chinese: 坚持住 (Jiānchí zhù) / 挺住 (Tǐng zhù)

example:
A: We must win this game.
B: At all costs.
A: Even cheating?
B: Let's stick to skill first.
A: Clean game.
B: Right.
japanese: どんな犠牲（ぎせい）を払（はら）っても。／何（なに）としても。
chinese: 怎么回事? (Zěnme huí shì?) / 为什么呢? (Wèishénme ne?)

example:
A: He resigned?
B: It was a bolt from the blue.
A: I thought he loved it here.
B: Guess not.
A: Who will replace him?
B: You?
japanese: 寝耳（ねみみ）に水（みず）。／青天（せいてん）の霹靂（へきれき）。
chinese: 我深表怀疑 (Wǒ shēnbiǎo huáiyí) / 恐怕不行 (Kǒngpà bùxíng)

example:
A: How is the project?
B: Falling apart.
A: Can we save it?
B: We need duct tape and a miracle.
A: I have duct tape.
B: Pray for the miracle.
japanese: ガタガタだ。／崩壊（ほうかい）寸前（すんぜん）。
chinese: 我洗耳恭听 (Wǒ xǐ'ěr gōngtīng) / 我听着呢 (Wǒ tīngzhe ne)

example:
A: Are you okay to drive?
B: I can't think straight.
A: Give me the keys.
B: Take them.
A: Safety first.
B: Thank you.
japanese: まともに考（かんが）える。／頭（あたま）を冷（ひ）やす。
chinese: 继续努力 (Jìxù nǔlì) / 保持住 (Bǎochí zhù)

example:
A: Lights off, please.
B: Migraine?
A: Yes, my head is exploding.
B: I'll get the pills.
A: Quietly.
B: Like a ninja.
japanese: 偏頭痛（へんずつう）。／ガンガンする。
chinese: 我的错 (Wǒ de cuò) / 抱歉 (Bàoqiàn)

example:
A: Did you invite Tom?
B: No, I left him out.
A: Why?
B: He eats all the pizza.
A: Fair point.
B: Exactly.
japanese: 仲間外（なかまはず）れにする。／ハブる。
chinese: 别介意 (Bié jièyì) / 没记仇 (Méi jìchóu)

example:
A: What's it like flying first class?
B: I wouldn't know.
A: Me neither.
B: Economy squalor for life.
A: Maybe one day.
B: Keep dreaming.
japanese: 知（し）らないなぁ。／未経験（みけいけん）だし。
chinese: 门儿都没有 (Ménr dōu méiyǒu) / 绝无可能 (Jué wú kěnéng)

example:
A: I can't believe he said that!
B: Don't get worked up.
A: I'm furious.
B: High blood pressure kills.
A: Thanks for the reminder.
B: Just breathe.
japanese: カッカしないで。／興奮（こうふん）しないで。
chinese: 没关系 (Méiguānxi) / 一点儿也不 (Yīdiǎnr yě bù)

primary: Will you take it to my room?
similar: Drop it off in my room.
example:
A: Your package arrived.
B: Will you take it to my room?
A: I'm not your butler.
B: Please?
A: Fine, this once.
B: Thanks.
japanese: 部屋（へや）に運（はこ）んでくれる？／持（も）ってきて。
chinese: 我也也是 (Wǒ yěshì) / 彼此彼此 (Bǐcǐ bǐcǐ)

example:
A: I'll have the lobster thermidor.
B: I'll have the same, please.
A: It's market price.
B: I'm rich today.
A: Payday?
B: Lottery.
japanese: 同（おな）じもので。／右（みぎ）に同（おな）じ。
chinese: 加油门 (Jiā yóumén) / 快点儿 (Kuài diǎnr)

primary: I've been meaning to tell you
similar: I meant to drop this on you
Been trying to find the right time
This has been on my mind
I gotta get this off my chest
example:
A: I've been meaning to tell you something.
B: Oh god, what did you do now?
A: Nothing bad! I'm moving to Brooklyn.
B: Finally! I've been saying that for years.
A: Yeah, yeah. You were right.
B: I'm always right, glad you caught up.
japanese: 言（い）おうと思（おも）ってたんだけど。／実（じつ）はね。
chinese: 保重 (Bǎozhòng) / 慢慢走 (Mànman zǒu)

example:
A: This cookie is divine.
B: Care for another?
A: Don't twist my arm.
B: Take two.
A: You're an angel.
B: I know.
japanese: もう一（ひと）つどう？／お代（か）わりは？
chinese: 谁说不是呢 (Shéi shuō bùshì ne) / 我太理解了 (Wǒ tài lǐjiě le)

example:
A: He lost his wallet again.
B: I feel for him, but he's careless.
A: He needs a chain.
B: Or a babysitter.
A: Mean.
B: Honest.
japanese: 気持（きも）ちはわかるよ。／同情（どうじょう）する。
chinese: 听着耳熟 (Tīngzhe ěrshú) / 好像在哪见过 (Hǎoxiàng zài nǎ jiànguò)

example:
A: Hey! How long has it been?
B: Since college graduation.
A: Five years?
B: Ten.
A: We're old.
B: Experienced.
japanese: どれくらいぶり？／何（なん）年（ねん）ぶり？
chinese: 三思而后行 (Sānsī ér hòu xíng) / 好好想想 (Hǎohǎo xiǎngxiǎng)

similar: What have you been up to?
example:
A: Hey! How have you been?
B: Busy but good.
A: Still working at Google?
B: Nope, started my own thing.
A: Fancy.
B: Stressful.
japanese: 元気（げんき）だった？／どうしてた？
chinese: 时间到 (Shíjiān dào) / 到点儿了 (Dào diǎnr le)

example:
A: Everyone hates cilantro.
B: I love it.
A: You're an outlier.
B: More for me.
A: True.
B: Enjoy your soap weed.
japanese: 変（か）わり種（だね）。／逸脱（いつだつ）してる。
chinese: 好样的 (Hǎoyàngde) / 干得漂亮 (Gàn de piàoliang)

similar: It would be nice to have.
example:
A: You look tired.
B: I could use some coffee.
A: Black?
B: Inject it into my veins.
A: Coming right up.
B: Savior.
japanese: 〜がほしいなぁ。／〜があればなぁ。
chinese: 怎么了? (Zěnme le?) / 出什么事了? (Chū shénme shì le?)

example:
A: The baby stopped crying instantly.
B: She has a way with children.
A: She's a whisperer.
B: She just has candy.
A: Ah, bribery.
B: Works every time.
japanese: 扱（あつか）いがうまい。／手（て）懐（なず）けてる。
chinese: 为什么不呢? (Wèishénme bù ne?) / 好主意 (Hǎo zhǔyì)

example:
A: I've never skied before.
B: Wow, you're a natural.
A: Or I'm just falling gracefully.
B: It looks good.
A: My knees hurt.
B: Drink hot cocoa.
japanese: 天才（てんさい）だね。／素質（そしつ）あるよ。
chinese: 你说对了 (Nǐ shuō duì le) / 没问题 (Méiwèntí)

primary: You have a way with words
example:
A: I convinced him to give us a discount.
B: You have a way with words.
A: I just cried.
B: Manipulative.
A: Whatever works.
B: True.
japanese: 口（くち）がうまいね。／言葉（ことば）巧（たく）みだ。
chinese: 不用谢 (Bùyòng xiè) / 别客气 (Bié kèqi)

primary: It just came naturally to me
similar: I didn't have to try hard.
I have a knack for it.
example:
A: How did you learn piano?
B: It just came naturally to me.
A: Mozart reborn?
B: Maybe.
A: Play something.
B: Chopsticks.
japanese: 自然（しぜん）とできるようになった。／体（からだ）が覚（おぼ）えた。
chinese: 难倒我了 (Nándǎo wǒ le) / 我也不太清楚 (Wǒ yě bù tài qīngchu)

similar: 5. Just a stab in the dark
example:
A: How much will the renovation cost?
B: I haven't gotten the final quote yet.
A: Can you just ballpark it for me?
B: I’d say somewhere between 10k and 15k.
A: Thanks, that rough estimate helps a lot.
B: Just keep in mind, the price might change.
japanese: ざっくりでいいから。／大体（だいたい）で。
chinese: 算我一个 (Suàn wǒ yīgè) / 我也参加 (Wǒ yě cānjiā)

example:
A: I wake up at 4 AM to run.
B: You're very disciplined.
A: Then I meditate.
B: I sleep till noon.
A: Try it.
B: No thanks.
japanese: 自分（じぶん）に厳（きび）しいね。／ストイックだね。
chinese: 别客气 (Bié kèqi) / 没啥 (Méishá)

example:
A: Did you hear that song?
B: It gives me chills.
A: In a good way?
B: Yes, she's amazing.
A: Encore.
B: Please.
japanese: 鳥肌（とりはだ）が立（た）つ。／ゾクゾクする。
chinese: 算你说的有道理 (Suàn nǐ shuō de yǒu dàolǐ) / 行吧 (Xíng ba)

primary: I got in the habit of
example:
A: You bite your nails.
B: I got in the habit of it during finals.
A: Stop it.
B: I'm trying.
A: Use the bitter polish.
B: It tastes bad.
japanese: 癖（くせ）になっちゃった。／習慣（しゅうかん）づいた。
chinese: 释怀吧 (Shìhuái ba) / 算了吧 (Suànle ba)

primary: Let me make it up to you
example:
A: You ruined my shirt.
B: Let me make it up to you. Dinner?
A: Steak.
B: Done.
A: And dessert.
B: Fine.
japanese: 償（つぐな）わせて。／借（か）りを返（かえ）させて。
chinese: 谁知道呢 (Shéi zhīdào ne) / 真没想到 (Zhēn méi xiǎngdào)

example:
A: Want to go hiking?
B: I'm feeling under the weather.
A: Fever?
B: Just tired and achey.
A: Stay home.
B: Will do.
japanese: 具合（ぐあい）が悪（わる）い。／調子（ちょうし）が出（で）ない。
chinese: 为你高兴 (Wèi nǐ gāoxìng) / 真不错 (Zhēn bùcuò)

example:
A: Why is your phone buzzing?
B: My tweet blew up.
A: Famous?
B: Briefly.
A: Don't forget us little people.
B: Never.
japanese: バズる。／キレる。
chinese: 你想得到吗? (Nǐ xiǎng de dào ma?) / 告诉你个事 (Gàosu nǐ gè shì)

example:
A: How's the view?
B: As good as it gets.
A: Paradise?
B: Pretty much.
A: Send photos.
B: Already did.
japanese: これ以上（いじょう）ない。／最高（さいこう）だ。
chinese: 祝你愉快 (Zhù nǐ yúkuài) / 走好 (Zǒuhǎo)

example:
A: You smoke?
B: I quit cold turkey last week.
A: Hard?
B: Hell yes.
A: Stay strong.
B: I need gum.
japanese: きっぱりやめる。／スパッとやめる。
chinese: 自便 (Zìbiàn) / 自己动手 (Zìjǐ dòngshǒu)

example:
A: Is this bag real?
B: It's legit.
A: How do you know?
B: I know a guy.
A: Suspicious.
B: Trust me.
japanese: ガチだ。／本物（ほんもの）だ。
chinese: 最近可好? (Zuìjìn kě hǎo?) / 情况怎么样? (Qíngkuàng zěnmeyàng?)

similar: He's out of my league (in reverse).
example:
A: Are you playing against Tom?
B: Yeah, he's no match for me.
A: Don't be cocky.
B: Just confident.
A: We'll see.
B: Watch and learn.
japanese: 相手（あいて）にならない。／敵（てき）じゃない。
chinese: 我等不及了 (Wǒ děngbùjí le) / 迫不及待 (Pòbùjídài)

example:
A: I'm trying to move this glass table alone.
B: Wait, let me help. Easy does it!
A: It's heavier than it looks, for sure.
B: Just steady now, don't hit the wall.
A: Almost there... just one more foot.
B: Perfect, let's set it down handle with care.
japanese: 慎重（しんちょう）に。／焦（あせ）らないで。
chinese: 我知晓了 (Wǒ zhīxiǎo le) / 原来是这样 (Yuánlái shì zhèyàng)

example:
A: Pick up milk.
B: Okie dokie.
A: And eggs.
B: Okie dokie artichokie.
A: Stop rhyming.
B: Nope.
japanese: りょうかい。／オッケー。
chinese: 这得看情况 (Zhè děi kàn qíngkuàng) / 视情况而定 (Shì qíngkuàng ér dìng)

example:
A: How was the movie?
B: Meh.
A: Waste of money?
B: Waste of time.
A: Sad.
B: Very.
japanese: ビミョー。／イマイチ。
chinese: 终于到时候了 (Zhōngyú dào shíhòu le) / 总算等到了 (Zǒngsuàn děng dào le)

example:
A: He was fired for stealing.
B: It makes sense.
A: Why?
B: He bought a boat on a cashier's salary.
A: Suspicious.
B: Exactly.
japanese: 辻褄（つじつま）が合（あ）う。／なるほどね。
chinese: 开玩笑呢 (Kāi wánxiào ne) / 逗你开心呢 (Dòu nǐ kāixīn ne)

example:
A: Let's run outside.
B: The air quality is bad.
A: Gym it is.
B: Don't forget your mask.
A: Inside?
B: Germs.
japanese: 空気（くうき）が悪（わる）い。／霞（かす）んでる。
chinese: 保持联系 (Bǎochí liánxì) / 多联系 (Duō liánxì)

example:
A: Do you like Mark?
B: Yeah, he's a chill guy.
A: Never angry?
B: Rarely.
A: Good roommate material.
B: The best.
japanese: 穏（おだ）やかな人（ひと）。／癒（いや）し系（けい）。
chinese: 咱们瞧瞧 (Zánmen qiáoqiao) / 走着瞧 (Zǒuzheqiáo)

example:
A: My phone is wet.
B: Put it in rice. This will do the trick.
A: Are you sure?
B: Asian wisdom.
A: Or myth.
B: Just try it.
japanese: これで効（き）くはず。／これで解決（かいけつ）。
chinese: 好久不见 (Hǎojiǔ bùjiàn) / 多年未见 (Duōnián wèi jiàn)

example:
A: What did you buy?
B: The tent, the stove, the whole shebang.
A: Going camping?
B: Glamping.
A: Fancy.
B: Always.
japanese: 全部（ぜんぶ）。／一式（いっしき）。
chinese: 当心 (Dāngxīn) / 小心 (Xiǎoxīn)

example:
A: Can you fix it?
B: Easy peasy lemon squeezy.
A: Just say yes.
B: Yes.
A: Thanks.
B: Anytime.
japanese: 超（ちょう）簡単（かんたん）。／楽勝（らくしょう）。
chinese: 讲得通 (Jiǎng de tōng) / 很有道理 (Hěn yǒu dàolǐ)

example:
A: Why is he so rude?
B: He has a chip on his shoulder.
A: About what?
B: Not getting promoted.
A: That was years ago.
B: He never forgets.
japanese: ふて腐（くさ）れてる。／喧嘩（けんか）越（ご）しだ。
chinese: 以后再说吧 (Yǐhòu zàishuō ba) / 下回吧 (Xiàhuí ba)

example:
A: She snapped at me.
B: She has a prickly attitude today.
A: Avoid her?
B: Definitely.
A: Safe plan.
B: Run away.
japanese: トゲトゲしてる。／ピリピリしてる。
chinese: 不要紧 (Bùyàojǐn) / 没关系 (Méiguānxi)

similar: 1. I hear that all the time
3. You're not the first to say that
example:
A: You look exactly like that famous actor!
B: Haha, I get that a lot actually.
A: Really? Does it ever get annoying?
B: So I've been told, but it's mostly a compliment.
A: You must have people asking for photos.
B: I hear that all the time, but not quite yet!
japanese: よく言（い）われる。／耳（みみ）にタコができるほど。
chinese: 没门儿 (Méiménr) / 绝对不行 (Juéduì bùxíng)

example:
A: Take a picture of me.
B: Okay.
A: Take it vertically for Instagram.
B: Influencer life.
A: Don't judge.
B: I am judging.
japanese: 縦（たて）で撮（と）って。／スマホサイズで。
chinese: 还不赖 (Hái bùlài) / 还可以 (Hái kěyǐ)

example:
A: Why are they fighting in the comments?
B: Just a troll.
A: Should I reply?
B: Don't feed the trolls.
A: Good advice.
B: Ignore them.
japanese: 荒（あ）らし。／釣（つ）り師（し）。
chinese: 当然了 (Dāngrán le) / 那还用说 (Nà hái yòng shuō)

example:
A: I lost my passport.
B: Don't panic.
A: I'm freaking out!
B: Check your bag again.
A: It's not there!
B: Check your pocket.
japanese: テンパってる。／パニクってる。
chinese: 不见不散 (Bùjiàn bùsàn) / 到时候一定要来 (Dào shíhòu yīdìng yào lái)

example:
A: Yo, is this place open today?
B: Yeah, we’re open till 10 PM. 
A: Bet. I’ll stop by in a bit.
B: Sounds good, see ya then.
A: Make sure you got those bagels ready.
B: You already know, we stacked.
japanese: ここやってる？／営業（えいぎょう）中（ちゅう）？
chinese: 别害羞 (Bié hàixiū) / 别不好意思 (Bié bù hǎoyìsi)

meaning: 사춘기 같은 한때야. (시간이 지나면 괜찮아질 거야)
example:
A: My brother is acting so weird lately.
B: He's probably just going through a phase.
A: He cut his hair and started listening to weird music.
B: Sounds like typical teen angst to me.
A: I hope he grows out of it soon.
B: He will, don't even trip.
japanese: そういう時期（じき）だよ。／反抗（はんこう）期（き）みたいなもん。
chinese: 安顿下来 (Āndùn xiàlái) / 住下来 (Zhù xiàlái)

meaning: 철들면 나아질 거야. (나이가 들면 그만둘 거야)
example:
A: Does he still throw tantrums?
B: Nah, he’ll grow out of it eventually.
A: I used to be like that when I was a kid.
B: Same, but we all find our way.
A: Now I'm just tired all the time.
B: Facts, adulting is hard out here.
japanese: そのうち直（なお）るよ。／大人（おとな）になればわかる。
chinese: 长大了就不这样了 (Zhǎngdà le jiù bù zhèyàng le) / 逐渐摆脱 (Zhújiàn bǎituō)

example:
A: The audience was hyped during the concert.
B: No cap, the energy was crazy.
A: I felt like a rockstar on that stage.
B: You were vibing hard, for real.
A: Next time we need a bigger venue.
B: Facts, we're definitely outgrowing this spot.
japanese: 観客（かんきゃく）。／リスナー。
chinese: 观众 (Guānzhòng) / 听众 (Tīngzhòng)

example:
A: That guy is such a leech, always asking for money.
B: Deadass, he never pays anyone back.
A: I'm done letting him crash at my place.
B: About time, he was straight mooching.
A: He's gonna be mad though.
B: Let him be mad, protect your peace.
japanese: 寄生虫（きせいちゅう）。／スネかじり。
chinese: 寄生虫 (Jìshēngchóng) / 赖着不走的人 (Làizhe bù zǒu de rén)

example:
A: Yo, don't go out without a coat. It’s freezing out!
B: Is it really that bad?
A: It’s brick outside, deadass.
B: My bad, I'll grab my puffer.
A: Good move, you'll thank me later.
B: Word, I'm not tryna be an icicle.
japanese: 極寒（ごっかん）だ。／シビれる寒（サム）さ。
chinese: 外面冻死人了! (Wàimiàn dòng sǐ rén le!) / 滴水成冰 (Dīshuǐchéngbīng)

meaning: 많은 생각을 하게 만드네. (깊은 영감을 줘)
example:
A: That documentary was really thought provoking.
B: It made me rethink a lot of things, lowkey.
A: Especially the part about social media.
B: Facts, it's actually kinda scary.
A: We should talk about it more later.
B: For sure, that's a deep convo right there.
japanese: 考（かんが）えさせられる。／深（ふか）い。
chinese: 发人深省的 (Fārénshēnxǐng de) / 引人深思 (Yǐnrénshēnsī)

primary: Spill the beans or keep silent
similar: 3. Give me the tea or stay quiet
5. Out with it or zip it
example:
A: I know what happened at the office party.
B: Well, spill the beans or keep silent.
A: You really want to know the drama?
B: Yes! Lay it on me right now.
A: Okay, but keep it between us.
B: My lips are sealed, just break it down for me.
japanese: 白状（はくじょう）しろ。／言（い）わないなら黙（だま）ってろ。
chinese: 要么坦白，要么闭嘴 (Yàome tǎnbái, yàome bìzuǐ) / 说还是不说 (Shuō háishì bù shuō)

example:
A: Yo, word is he called off the project.
B: Deadass? That's music to my ears!
A: I knew you'd be happy, you were stressed.
B: Real talk, I was already spread too thin.
A: Now you can finally catch a break.
B: Facts, I'm about to go home and sleep.
japanese: プロジェクト取（と）りやめたって。／中止（ちゅうし）になった。
chinese: 他取消了项目 (Tā qǔxiāo le xiàngmù) / 项目停工了 (Xiàngmù tínggōng le)

example:
A: Yo, are you really eating a whole pizza?
B: Duh, it's my cheat day!
A: No cap, that looks fire though.
B: You want a slice? I'm sharing.
A: I shouldn't, but I'm tryna vibe.
B: Say less, take two.
japanese: チートデイだ。／爆食（ばくしょく）の日（ひ）。
chinese: 今天是我的放纵日 (Jīntiān shì wǒ de fàngzòng rì) / 偶尔解个馋 (Ǒu'ér jiě gè chán)

example:
A: You look like a zombie, what happened?
B: Man, I had trouble sleeping last night.
A: Stressing about work again?
B: Facts, I couldn't stop thinking about that deadline.
A: You gotta learn to turn your brain off.
B: Easier said than done, for real.
japanese: よく眠（ねむ）れなかった。／寝不足（ねぶそく）だ。
chinese: 我失眠了 (Wǒ shīmián le) / 晚上没睡好 (Wǎnshàng méi shuì hǎo)

example:
A: How was the party last night?
B: Yo, I had a blast! It was too lit.
A: I knew it was gonna be a whole movie.
B: Facts, the music was fire and the crowd was hyped.
A: Wish I could've made it.
B: Next time for sure, no cap.
japanese: めっちゃ楽（たの）しかった。／最高（さいこう）の思（おも）い出（で）。
chinese: 我玩得太开心了 (Wǒ wán de tài kāixīn le) / 真是太爽了 (Zhēn shì tài shuǎng le)

example:
A: Where's Mike? I haven't seen him all day.
B: Dunno, he was tryna hit the gym earlier.
A: Did he mention which one?
B: Nah, he just bailed around noon.
A: I'll just shoot him a text.
B: Word, let me know if he hits you back.
japanese: イケてる？／似合（にあ）ってる？
chinese: 不知道 (Bù zhīdào) / 谁晓得 (Shéi xiǎodé)

meaning: 여자애들이란... (이해할 수 없는 행동을 할 때)
example:
A: They've been in the bathroom for like 30 minutes.
B: Girls... they're probably taking a million selfies.
A: No cap, they're tryna get that perfect lighting.
B: For real, they gonna miss the whole movie.
A: Let's just start without them.
B: Say less, I'm already opening the popcorn.
japanese: まだ早（早）いよ。／時期（じき）尚早（しょうそう）。
chinese: 女人啊... (Nǚrén a...) / 小姑娘们 (Xiǎo gūniangmen)

example:
A: Yo, thanks for the meal, how much do I owe you?
B: Nah, it's on me. Don't even worry about it.
A: For real? You don't have to do that.
B: You already know, I'm tryna look out for my homies.
A: I appreciate that, I'll get the next one then.
B: Bet, that's a deal.
japanese: イライラして爆発（ばくはつ）する。／ブチ切（ぎ）れる。
chinese: 我请客 (Wǒ qǐngkè) / 算我账上 (Suàn wǒ zhàng shàng)

example:
A: Yo, why are you wearing a t-shirt?
B: Honestly, it's warm for November. I'm vibing.
A: Facts, I was expecting it to be brick outside.
B: Right? The sun is actually hitting today.
A: I might even take my hoodie off.
B: Do it, catch those last few rays of sun.
japanese: 自分（じぶん）を持（も）って。／流（なが）されるな。
chinese: 对十一月来说挺暖和的 (Duì shíyīyuè lái shuō tǐng nuǎnhuo de) / 十一月还这么暖和 (Shíyīyuè hái zhème nuǎnhuo)

example:
A: How's that new ramen spot?
B: It's good for the price, but not the best in the city.
A: No cap? I heard people hyping it up.
B: It's alright, but you get what you pay for, deadass.
A: I'll probably just stick to our usual spot then.
B: Smart move, nothing beats a classic.
japanese: お見舞（みま）い申（もう）し上（あ）げます。／残念（ざんねん）でしたね（お悔（く）やみ）。
chinese: 性价比挺高 (Xìngjiàbǐ tǐng gāo) / 物超所值 (Wù chāo suǒ zhí)

meaning: 그냥 내 생각을 입 밖으로 내본 거야. (혼잣말이야)
example:
A: Wait, did you say we should move to Brooklyn?
B: Oh, I'm just thinking out loud. Don't take it too seriously.
A: Lowkey, it's not a bad idea though.
B: Facts, the vibes in Bushwick are immaculate.
A: We should definitely look into it later.
B: For sure, let's keep that on the table.
japanese: 考（かんが）え直（なお）す。／再考（さいこう）する。
chinese: 我只是随口说说想法 (Wǒ zhǐshì suíkǒu shuōshuo xiǎngfǎ) / 自言自语罢了 (Zìyánzìyǔ bàle)

meaning: 너무 깊게 생각하지 마 (의미 부여 마)
similar: 3. Don't make a mountain out of a molehill
example:
A: He didn't text me back for three hours.
B: Don’t read into that much, he's busy.
A: You think he's losing interest in me?
B: Seriously, it's not that deep.
A: I keep checking my phone every minute.
B: Stop over-analyzing and just relax.
japanese: 要点（ようてん）はそこじゃない。／ズレてるよ。
chinese: 别想太多 (Bié xiǎng tài duō) / 别过度解读 (Bié guòdù jiědú)
